cyclone.name: ELSA
cyclone.current_location: about 100 mi S of Camaguey, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest across Cuba, then north-northwest into the eastern Gulf, turning northeast and tracking inland across GA/SC/NC before accelerating northeast toward the Mid-Atlantic coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: west coast of Florida (likely Big Bend / Nature Coast area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch for central Cuba; Tropical Storm Watch Florida Keys east of Craig Key to Ocean Reef, Florida Bay, west coast of Florida Flamingo to Anclote River
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning central and eastern Cuba, Florida Keys Craig Key westward to Dry Tortugas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Cuba, Florida Keys and west coast, then Georgia through the Carolinas and Mid-Atlantic coastline
weather_observation.wind: Gusty winds 25–35 mph possible late Thu into Fri with a low (<10%) chance of sustained tropical-storm–force winds
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected in upper Chesapeake Bay
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches of rain possible Thu – Fri, brief urban/poor-drainage flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Low risk of isolated tornadoes as remnants pass; minor visibility/ceiling reductions for air operations
